definition: to swing/to sway/to wobble/to hang around/to hover around
long or drawn out/remote in time or space/leisurely/to swing/pensive/worried

sentences.english: so we would always hang out in Union Square.
sentences.chinese: 我們經常在聯合廣場上晃悠。

sentences.english: But I look like the good-for-nothing to be ordinary, at home shakes, keeps silent.
sentences.chinese: 而我則像行屍走肉一般，在家裏晃悠，不言不語。

sentences.english: Dishes are stacked unstably on acrobat's head.
sentences.chinese: 雜技演員頭上晃晃悠悠地頂着一疊磁碟。

sentences.english: She roller skated across rather unsteadily.
sentences.chinese: 她穿着旱冰鞋晃晃悠悠地滑了過去。

sentences.english: “I guess.” Julia said as they sauntered off towards their classroom.
sentences.chinese: 她們晃晃悠悠地朝教室走去。

sentences.english: After lunch Jack went out and wandered slowly round the circus tent.
sentences.chinese: 午飯後，傑克走了出去，繞着馬戲團的帳篷慢慢晃悠。

sentences.english: Acrobat sustains a pile of discs by the top of his head jiggly.
sentences.chinese: 雜技演員頭上晃晃悠悠地頂着一疊瓷碟。

sentences.english: By the time I left the third bar, I was three sheets to the wind.
sentences.chinese: 當我走出第三個酒巴時，我的身子已經是晃悠悠的了。

sentences.english: The rocking boats along the river bank make a beautiful scene.
sentences.chinese: 河邊晃晃悠悠的船隻構成了一道美麗的風景。

sentences.english: Strange creatures are wiggling their way down from outerspace.
sentences.chinese: 奇怪的生物正從外太空晃晃悠悠地下來。

sentences.english: But I remembered him and the leather crop swinging from his belt.
sentences.chinese: 但是我記得他和他皮帶上晃悠的皮鞭。

sentences.english: This is a hammock station. You can dangle to wait for the arrival of public transportation.
sentences.chinese: 吊牀車站，你可以晃晃悠悠地等待公交的到來。

sentences.english: Acrobats are carrying a pile of diskettes on their heads rickety .
sentences.chinese: 雜技演員頭上晃晃悠悠地頂着一疊磁碟。

sentences.english: Her ladyship won't want workmen under he feet.
sentences.chinese: 夫人她討厭看到工人在她家晃悠。

sentences.english: After lunch Jack went out and wandered slowly around the circus tent.
sentences.chinese: 午飯後，傑克走了出去，繞着馬戲團的帳篷慢慢晃悠。

definition: to roll/to wander around/to appear repeatedly
to stroll/to go for a walk
to bounce/to jump/to hop/also variant of 蹦達|蹦达[beng4 da2]
to rove around/to run around in circles/to walk back and forth
to look in all directions (idiom)/to glance around
to go sightseeing/to spend one's leisure time wandering around
